These scenarios may increase the risk of a crash.", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov. ', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling all 2015-2017 Transit vehicles except 156" and 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies.  In the affected vehicles, the flexible coupling connecting the transmission to the driveshaft may prematurely fail.', u'Remedy': u"Ford will notify owners, and as an interim repair, dealers will replace the flexible coupling on any vehicle with more than 30,000 miles.  A final remedy repair of a redesigned flexible coupling or a revised driveshaft equipped with a universal joint is being developed and is expected in early 2018.  These repairs will be made free of charge.  Interim notifications informing owners of the safety risk were mailed July 21, 2017.  Owners will receive a second notice when remedy parts become available.  Owners may contact Ford customer service at 1-866-436-7332. This recall includes all full-size Transit vehicles   previously recalled under 17V-408 except ones that received mechanical universal joint (u-joint) as a remedy and any 156" or 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies models.  The flexible coupling connecting the transmission to the driveshaft may prematurely fail.', u'Remedy': u"Ford will notify owners, and as an interim repair, dealers will replace the flexible coupling every 40,000 miles until the final remedy is available. Owners may contact Ford customer service at 1-866-436-7332.  Ford's number for this recall is 19S38. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V408000', u'Conequence': u"If the coupling fails, the vehicle will not be able to move under its own power and the disconnected driveshaft may impact and damage the brake and fuel lines. ', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling all 2015-2017 Transit vehicles except 156" and 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies. These repairs will be made free of charge.  Interim notifications informing owners of the safety risk were mailed July 21, 2017. Additionally, the separated driveshaft may allow the vehicle to roll if the vehicle is exited when the transmission is in 'Park' but the parking brake is not applied. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V408000', u'Conequence': u"If the coupling fails, the vehicle will not be able to move under its own power and the disconnected driveshaft may impact and damage the brake and fuel lines. ', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling all 2015-2017 Transit vehicles except 156" and 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies.  In the affected vehicles, the flexible coupling connecting the transmission to the driveshaft may prematurely fail.', u'Remedy': u"Ford will notify owners, and as an interim repair, dealers will replace the flexible coupling on any vehicle with more than 30,000 miles.  A final remedy repair of a redesigned flexible coupling or a revised driveshaft equipped with a universal joint is being developed and is expected in early 2018.  These repairs will be made free of charge.  Interim notifications informing owners of the safety risk were mailed July 21, 2017.  Owners will receive a second notice when remedy parts become available.  Owners may contact Ford customer service at 1-866-436-7332.  Ford's number for this recall is 17S15.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'TRANSIT', u'Make': u'FORD', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1498449600000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Ford Motor Company'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V668000', u'Conequence': u'An electrical short can increase the risk of a fire. Additionally, the separated driveshaft may allow the vehicle to roll if the vehicle is exited when the transmission is in 'Park' but the parking brake is not applied.  These scenarios may increase the risk of a crash or injury.", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Transit vehicles.  This recall includes all full-size Transit vehicles   previously recalled under 17V-408 except ones that received mechanical universal joint (u-joint) as a remedy and any 156" or 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies models.  The flexible coupling connecting the transmission to the driveshaft may prematurely fail.', u'Remedy': u"Ford will notify owners, and as an interim repair, dealers will replace the flexible coupling every 40,000 miles until the final remedy is available.  The final remedy will consist of installation of a driveshaft front section equipped with a mechanical u-joint in place of the flexible coupling.  These repairs will be made free of charge.  Owners may contact Ford customer service at 1-866-436-7332.  Ford's number for this recall is 19S38.  Note: This recall supersedes recall number 17V-408.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'TRANSIT', u'Make': u'FORD', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1571976000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Ford Motor Company'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V408000', u'Conequence': u"If the coupling fails, the vehicle will not be able to move under its own power and the disconnected driveshaft may impact and damage the brake and fuel lines.  Additionally, the separated driveshaft may allow the vehicle to roll if the vehicle is exited when the transmission is in 'Park' but the parking brake is not applied.  These scenarios may increase the risk of a crash.", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov. ', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling all 2015-2017 Transit vehicles except 156" and 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies.  In the affected vehicles, the flexible coupling connecting the transmission to the driveshaft may prematurely fail.', u'Remedy': u"Ford will notify owners, and as an interim repair, dealers will replace the flexible coupling on any vehicle with more than 30,000 miles.  A final remedy repair of a redesigned flexible coupling or a revised driveshaft equipped with a universal joint is being developed and is expected in early 2018.  These repairs will be made free of charge.  Interim notifications informing owners of the safety risk were mailed July 21, 2017.  Owners will receive a second notice when remedy parts become available.  Owners may contact Ford customer service at 1-866-436-7332.  Ford's number for this recall is 17S15.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'TRANSIT', u'Make': u'FORD', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1498449600000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Ford Motor Company'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V668000', u'Conequence': u'An electrical short can increase the risk of a fire. ', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'TRANSIT', u'Make': u'FORD', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1556510400000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'New England Wheels'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V767000', u'Conequence': u"If the coupling fails, the vehicle will not be able to move under its own power and the disconnected driveshaft may impact and damage the brake and fuel lines.  Additionally, the separated driveshaft may allow the vehicle to roll if the vehicle is exited when the transmission is in 'Park' but the parking brake is not applied.  These scenarios may increase the risk of a crash or injury.", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Transit vehicles.  This recall includes all full-size Transit vehicles   previously recalled under 17V-408 except ones that received mechanical universal joint (u-joint) as a remedy and any 156" or 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies models.  The flexible coupling connecting the transmission to the driveshaft may prematurely fail.', u'Remedy': u"Ford will notify owners, and as an interim repair, dealers will replace the flexible coupling every 40,000 miles until the final remedy is available.  The final remedy will consist of installation of a driveshaft front section equipped with a mechanical u-joint in place of the flexible coupling.  These repairs will be made free of charge.  Owners may contact Ford customer service at 1-866-436-7332.  Ford's number for this recall is 19S38.  Note: This recall supersedes recall number 17V-408.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'TRANSIT', u'Make': u'FORD', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1571976000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Ford Motor Company'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V408000', u'Conequence': u"If the coupling fails, the vehicle will not be able to move under its own power and the disconnected driveshaft may impact and damage the brake and fuel lines.  Additionally, the separated driveshaft may allow the vehicle to roll if the vehicle is exited when the transmission is in 'Park' but the parking brake is not applied.  These scenarios may increase the risk of a crash.", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov. ', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling all 2015-2017 Transit vehicles except 156" and 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies.  In the affected vehicles, the flexible coupling connecting the transmission to the driveshaft may prematurely fail.', u'Remedy': u"Ford will notify owners, and as an interim repair, dealers will replace the flexible coupling on any vehicle with more than 30,000 miles.  A final remedy repair of a redesigned flexible coupling or a revised driveshaft equipped with a universal joint is being developed and is expected in early 2018.  These repairs will be made free of charge.  Interim notifications informing owners of the safety risk were mailed July 21, 2017.  Owners will receive a second notice when remedy parts become available.  Owners may contact Ford customer service at 1-866-436-7332.  Ford's number for this recall is 17S15.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'TRANSIT', u'Make': u'FORD', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1498449600000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Ford Motor Company'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V668000', u'Conequence': u'An electrical short can increase the risk of a fire. Additionally, the separated driveshaft may allow the vehicle to roll if the vehicle is exited when the transmission is in 'Park' but the parking brake is not applied.  These scenarios may increase the risk of a crash or injury.", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Transit vehicles.  This recall includes all full-size Transit vehicles   previously recalled under 17V-408 except ones that received mechanical universal joint (u-joint) as a remedy and any 156" or 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies models.  The flexible coupling connecting the transmission to the driveshaft may prematurely fail.', u'Remedy': u"Ford will notify owners, and as an interim repair, dealers will replace the flexible coupling every 40,000 miles until the final remedy is available. Additionally, the separated driveshaft may allow the vehicle to roll if the vehicle is exited when the transmission is in 'Park' but the parking brake is not applied.  These scenarios may increase the risk of a crash or injury.", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Transit vehicles.  This recall includes all full-size Transit vehicles   previously recalled under 17V-408 except ones that received mechanical universal joint (u-joint) as a remedy and any 156" or 178" wheelbase Chassis Cab and Cut-Away bodies models.  The flexible coupling connecting the transmission to the driveshaft may prematurely fail.', u'Remedy': u"Ford will notify owners, and as an interim repair, dealers will replace the flexible coupling every 40,000 miles until the final remedy is available.  The final remedy will consist of installation of a driveshaft front section equipped with a mechanical u-joint in place of the flexible coupling.  These repairs will be made free of charge.  Owners may contact Ford customer service at 1-866-436-7332.  Ford's number for this recall is 19S38.  Note: This recall supersedes recall number 17V-408.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'TRANSIT', u'Make': u'FORD', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1571976000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Ford Motor Company'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V538000', u'Conequence': u'Oil leaking onto the exhaust manifold increases the risk of a fire. ', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING:ENGINE:GASOLINE:TURBO-CHARGER | ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING:EXHAUST SYSTEM:MANIFOLD/HEADER/MUFFLER/TAIL PIPE', u'Summary': u'Hyundai Motor America (Hyundai) is recalling certain 2018 Genesis G80 and 2017-2018 Genesis G90 vehicles equipped with 3.3 liter turbocharged engines. The recall began October 3, 2019.  Owners may contact Hyundai customer service at 1-855-371-9460.  Hyundai's number for this recall is 003G.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'G90', u'Make': u'GENESIS', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1563508800000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Hyundai Motor America'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V802000', u'Conequence': u'If there is a brake fluid leak, braking performance may be reduced, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:FOUNDATION COMPONENTS:DISC:CALIPER', u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain model year 2017 Cadillac XT5 vehicles manufactured April 16, 2016, to May 9, 2016, and 2017 GMC Acadia vehicles manufactured April 19, 2016, to April 22, 2016.  The front brake calipers may have a torn or misaligned caliper piston seal which may allow brake fluid to leak.', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will inspect the front brake calipers, replacing the brake caliper assemblies, as necessary, free of charge.  The recall began on December 12, 2016.  Owners may contact GM customer service at 1-800-458-8006 (Cadillac), or 1-800-462-8782 (GMC).  GM's number for this recall is 16096.  ", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'ACADIA', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1478232000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V516000', u'Conequence': u'If the front right intermediate drive shaft assembly separates while driving, the vehicle will lose propulsion, increasing the risk of a crash.  If the assembly separates while parked on a grade, without the park brake engaged, the vehicle may move unintentionally, increasing the risk of a vehicle roll-away.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2018 Chevrolet Equinox and GMC Terrain vehicles and 2017-2018 GMC Acadia  vehicles.  The right front intermediate driveshaft may fracture and separate while driving.', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will replace the right front intermediate drive shaft assembly, free of charge.  The recall began August 25, 2017.  Owners may contact GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782 or Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-222-1020.  GM's number for this recall is 17329.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'ACADIA', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1503374400000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V358000', u'Conequence': u'A damaged fuel line can create a fuel leak, increasing the risk of a fire.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:DELIVERY:FUEL PUMP', u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2015-2018 GMC Canyon, 2016-2017 Buick Envision, 2016-2018 Chevrolet Colorado and Malibu, 2017-2018 GMC Acadia, 2018 Buick LaCrosse, Cadillac ATS, Chevrolet Equinox, and GMC Terrain vehicles.  The high pressure fuel pump may detach from its mounting flange, possibly resulting in the pump damaging the high pressure fuel line.', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will replace the high pressure fuel pump, and high pressure fuel pipe, free of charge.  The recall began July 2, 2018.  Owners may contact Buick customer service at 1-800-521-7300, Cadillac customer service at 1-800-458-8006, Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-222-1020, or GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782.  GM's number for this recall is 18188.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'ACADIA', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1527739200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V267000', u'Conequence': u'In the event of a fire, if the fire extinguisher does not function properly, it can increase the risk of injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT', u'Summary': u"General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2009-2014 Chevrolet Silverado HD and GMC Sierra HD, 2009 GMC Topkick 5000, 6000, 7000 and 8000 Series and Isuzu F Series, and 2009-2018 Chevrolet Express, and GMC Savana vehicles, equipped with certain Plastic-Handle Fire Extinguishers or Push Button 'Pindicator' Fire Extinguishers.  These extinguishers may become clogged, preventing the extinguisher from discharging as expected or requiring excessive force to activate the extinguisher.  Additionally, in certain models, the nozzle may detach from the valve assembly with enough force that it could cause injury and also render the product inoperable.  For a full list of the affected fire extinguisher models visit: https://static.nhtsa.gov/odi/rcl/2017/RMISC-17E062-5427.pdf", u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, instructing them to contact Kidde to get a replacement fire extinguisher, free of charge.  The recall began June 11, 2018. Owners may contact Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-222-1020, GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782, and Isuzu customer service at 1-866-441-9638.  GM's number for this recall is 18146.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'SAVANA', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1524715200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V295000', u'Conequence': u'High electrical resistance can increase the risk of a fire.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'VISIBILITY:POWER WINDOW DEVICES AND CONTROLS', u'Summary': u"General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2014-2017 Chevrolet Express and GMC Savana vehicles equipped with power windows.  Liquid may leak into the driver's power window switch and cause corrosion, resulting in high electrical resistance.", u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will replace the driver side window switch, free of charge.  The recall began August 10, 2018.   Owners may contact Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-222-1020 or GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782.  GM's number for this recall is 18155.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'SAVANA', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1525320000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V655000', u'Conequence': u"If the CCM overheats, there is an increased risk of a fire in the vehicle's headliner.", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM', u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2016-2018 Chevrolet Express and GMC Sierra vehicles equipped with a single, manual, rear climate control module (CCM).  If the temperature is set to maximum heat or the mode knob is set to maximum floor vent and an electrical short occurs, components within the CCM may overheat.', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will remove the electrical insulation from a wiring connector within the CCM to remove the fire risk, free of charge. (Unicell) is recalling certain 2017-2019 Chevrolet Express and GMC Savanna, 2018-2019 Hino 155, Ford Econoline and Transit and Isuzu NPR, and 2018 Ram ProMaster-based vehicles equipped with ASA Electronics Voyager monitors used to display the back-up camera image.  The affected monitors may revert back to the factory default settings which may cause the camera image to be reversed. ', u'Remedy': u'Unicell will work with ASA Electronics to notify owners and offer a remedy, free of charge.  The recall began May 9, 2019. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V267000', u'Conequence': u'In the event of a fire, if the fire extinguisher does not function properly, it can increase the risk of injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT', u'Summary': u"General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2009-2014 Chevrolet Silverado HD and GMC Sierra HD, 2009 GMC Topkick 5000, 6000, 7000 and 8000 Series and Isuzu F Series, and 2009-2018 Chevrolet Express, and GMC Savana vehicles, equipped with certain Plastic-Handle Fire Extinguishers or Push Button 'Pindicator' Fire Extinguishers. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V651000', u'Conequence': u'A failure of the front air bags or seat belt pretensioners to deploy in the event of a crash necessitating deployment increases the risk of injury to the driver and front passenger.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS:FRONTAL | AIR BAGS:FRONTAL:SENSOR/CONTROL MODULE | SEAT BELTS:PRETENSIONER', u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain model year 2015-2017 Chevrolet Silverado 2500 HD, 3500 HD, Tahoe, Suburban,  GMC Sierra 2500 HD and 3500 HD, GMC Yukon, GMC Yukon XL, Cadillac Escalade and Cadillac Escalade ESV vehicles and 2014-2017 Chevrolet Corvette, Silverado 1500, Trax, Caprice Police Pursuit Vehicle, GMC Sierra 1500, Buick Encore, and 2014-2016 Buick Lacrosse, Chevrolet Spark EV and SS vehicles.  In the affected vehicles, certain driving conditions may cause the air bag sensing and diagnostic module (SDM) software to activate a diagnostic test.  During this test, deployment of the frontal air bags and the seat belt pretensioners would not occur in the event of a crash.', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will reflash the SDM software.  Vehicles that have had a previous air bag deployment will have the SDM replaced.  These repairs will be performed free of charge.  The recall began on October 13, 2016.  Owners may contact Buick customer service at 1-800-521-7300, Cadillac customer service at 1-800-458-8006, Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-222-1020, or GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782.  GM's number for this recall is 16007.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'YUKON', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1473307200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V645000', u'Conequence': u'As the vacuum level drops, the brake assist decreases, increasing braking effort, extending the distance required to stop the vehicle, thereby increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:POWER ASSIST:VACUUM', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will reprogram the Electronic Brake Control Module, free of charge.  The recall began October 8, 2019.  Owners may contact Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-630-2438, Cadillac customer service at 1-800-458-8006 or GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782.  GM's number for this recall is N192268490.", u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Cadillac Escalade, 2014-2018 Chevrolet Silverado, GMC Sierra, 2015-2018 Chevrolet Suburban, Tahoe, GMC Yukon vehicles.  The amount of vacuum created by the vacuum pump may decrease over time.', u'NHTSAActionNumber': u'PE18012', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'YUKON', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1567742400000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V761000', u'Conequence': u'Unintended activation of the driveline-protection system will cause unintended braking on the wheel on the opposite side of the failed sensor, causing the vehicle to pull to one side unexpectedly, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRONIC STABILITY CONTROL | SERVICE BRAKES | SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:ANTILOCK:WHEEL SPEED SENSOR', u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2015-2020 Chevrolet Suburban, Tahoe, and GMC Yukon, and 2014-2018 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 and GMC Sierra 1500 vehicles equipped with a 5.3-liter engine, a 3.08-ratio rear axle and four-wheel drive.  If a wheel-speed sensor fails, while the vehicle is traveling between 41 and 60 mph in four-wheel or automatic mode, the Electronic-Brake Control Module (EBCM) software may activate the driveline-protection system.', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will reprogram the EBCM, free of charge.  The recall began December 11, 2019.  Owners may contact Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-630-2438 or GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782.  GM's number for this recall is N192261050.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'YUKON', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1571889600000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V651000', u'Conequence': u'A failure of the front air bags or seat belt pretensioners to deploy in the event of a crash necessitating deployment increases the risk of injury to the driver and front passenger.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS:FRONTAL | AIR BAGS:FRONTAL:SENSOR/CONTROL MODULE | SEAT BELTS:PRETENSIONER', u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain model year 2015-2017 Chevrolet Silverado 2500 HD, 3500 HD, Tahoe, Suburban,  GMC Sierra 2500 HD and 3500 HD, GMC Yukon, GMC Yukon XL, Cadillac Escalade and Cadillac Escalade ESV vehicles and 2014-2017 Chevrolet Corvette, Silverado 1500, Trax, Caprice Police Pursuit Vehicle, GMC Sierra 1500, Buick Encore, and 2014-2016 Buick Lacrosse, Chevrolet Spark EV and SS vehicles.  In the affected vehicles, certain driving conditions may cause the air bag sensing and diagnostic module (SDM) software to activate a diagnostic test.  During this test, deployment of the frontal air bags and the seat belt pretensioners would not occur in the event of a crash.', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will reflash the SDM software.  Vehicles that have had a previous air bag deployment will have the SDM replaced.  These repairs will be performed free of charge.  The recall began on October 13, 2016.  Owners may contact Buick customer service at 1-800-521-7300, Cadillac customer service at 1-800-458-8006, Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-222-1020, or GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782.  GM's number for this recall is 16007.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'YUKON', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1473307200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V645000', u'Conequence': u'As the vacuum level drops, the brake assist decreases, increasing braking effort, extending the distance required to stop the vehicle, thereby increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:POWER ASSIST:VACUUM', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will reprogram the Electronic Brake Control Module, free of charge.  The recall began October 8, 2019.  Owners may contact Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-630-2438, Cadillac customer service at 1-800-458-8006 or GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782.  GM's number for this recall is N192268490.", u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Cadillac Escalade, 2014-2018 Chevrolet Silverado, GMC Sierra, 2015-2018 Chevrolet Suburban, Tahoe, GMC Yukon vehicles.  The amount of vacuum created by the vacuum pump may decrease over time.', u'NHTSAActionNumber': u'PE18012', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'YUKON', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1567742400000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V761000', u'Conequence': u'Unintended activation of the driveline-protection system will cause unintended braking on the wheel on the opposite side of the failed sensor, causing the vehicle to pull to one side unexpectedly, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRONIC STABILITY CONTROL | SERVICE BRAKES | SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:ANTILOCK:WHEEL SPEED SENSOR', u'Summary': u'General Motors LLC (GM) is recalling certain 2015-2020 Chevrolet Suburban, Tahoe, and GMC Yukon, and 2014-2018 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 and GMC Sierra 1500 vehicles equipped with a 5.3-liter engine, a 3.08-ratio rear axle and four-wheel drive.  If a wheel-speed sensor fails, while the vehicle is traveling between 41 and 60 mph in four-wheel or automatic mode, the Electronic-Brake Control Module (EBCM) software may activate the driveline-protection system.', u'Remedy': u"GM will notify owners, and dealers will reprogram the EBCM, free of charge.  The recall began December 11, 2019.  Owners may contact Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-630-2438 or GMC customer service at 1-800-462-8782.  GM's number for this recall is N192261050.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'YUKON', u'Make': u'GMC', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1571889600000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'General Motors LLC'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V060000', u'Conequence': u'Reduced fuel pump performance can result in an engine stall, increasing the risk of crash. ', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'FUEL SYSTEM, OTHER:DELIVERY:FUEL PUMP', u'Summary': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2016-2018 Acura MDX, 2015-2019 Acura TLX and 2015-2017 Honda Accord vehicles, equipped with a 3.5L V6 engine. Honda's recall number for this recall is N3X.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'ACCORD', u'Make': u'HONDA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1548738000000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.)'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V706000', u'Conequence': u'The improper heat treatment can result in the halfshaft breaking, preventing the engine from moving the vehicle, and can allow a possible roll away situation if the parking brake is not engaged.  This can increase the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'POWER TRAIN:DRIVELINE:DRIVESHAFT', u'Summary': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2017 Honda Civic Sedan and Coupe vehicles.  The right halfshaft may have been improperly heat treated, reducing its strength.', u'Remedy': u"Honda will notify owners, and dealers will inspect the halfshaft's serial number, replacing it as necessary and aligning the front wheels, free of charge.  The recall began December 8, 2017.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138.  Honda's number for this recall is K0E.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'CIVIC', u'Make': u'HONDA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1510203600000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.)'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V266000', u'Conequence': u'If the seat-mounted air bags cannot not deploy correctly in the event of a crash, there would be an increased risk of injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS | SEATS', u'Summary': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2017 Honda Civic Hatchback and Civic Type R vehicles.  Driver and front passenger seatback pads sold as replacement service parts were made without slit openings for the seat-mounted side air bags. In the event of a crash necessitating air bag deployment, the seatback pad would interfere and adversely affect air bag performance.  As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) number 214, "Side Impact Protection."', u'Remedy': u"Honda will notify owners, and dealers will replace the front seatback pads, free of charge.  The recall began June 15, 2018.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138.  Honda's number for this recall is E1D, U1B, and X1C.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'CIVIC', u'Make': u'HONDA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1524715200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.)'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V663000', u'Conequence': u'The unintended steering input reduces vehicle maneuverability and increases the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'STEERING:ELECTRIC POWER ASSIST SYSTEM', u'Summary': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2017-2018 Honda Civic and CR-V vehicles.  The magnet that controls the\r\ntorque sensor output signal for the electronic power steering system may not be properly secured, allowing the magnet to become dislodged.  During a full lock turn, the dislodged magnet may cause steering assist to be applied in the opposite direction.', u'Remedy': u"Honda will notify owners, and dealers will replace the steering gearbox assembly, free of charge.  The recall began November 9, 2018.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138.  Honda's numbers for this recall are C2N, P2O.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'CIVIC', u'Make': u'HONDA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1538020800000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.)'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V817000', u'Conequence': u'If the information is missing or improper, it can increase the risk of injury or a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT:OTHER:OWNERS/SERVICE/OTHER MANUAL ', u'Summary': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2017-2018 Honda Civic Hatchback and Civic Type R vehicles.  The owners guide in these vehicles may not have been included or  if included, the owner\'s guide may not have been properly provided required information.  As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) number 225, "Child Restraint Anchorage Systems."', u'Remedy': u"Honda will notify owners, and dealers will replace the owners information kit, free of charge.  The recall began January 9, 2019.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138.  Honda's number for this recall is O3A.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'CIVIC', u'Make': u'HONDA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1542344400000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.)'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V256000', u'Conequence': u'If the label information can be wiped away, the operator may not be able to refer to the information, possibly resulting in the vehicle being overloaded, which can increase the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov. ', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT:OTHER:LABELS', u'Summary': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2017 CR-V and Acura RDX vehicles.  The Certification Labels on the affected vehicles were printed with ink that may be inadvertently wiped away with an alcohol solvent.  As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of 49 CFR Part 567, "Certification."  ', u'Remedy': u"Honda and Acura will notify owners, and dealers will replace the Certification Label, free of charge.  The recall began June 2017.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138. ', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY\r\n1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov. The recall began August 31, 2017.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V725000', u'Conequence': u'If the seat tips forward during braking, it can increase the risk of injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SEATS:MID/REAR ASSEMBLY', u'Summary': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2011-2017 Honda Odyssey vehicles.  The second row outboard seats can slide sideways to one of two positions.  If a seat is placed between either of the two positions when attaching the seat to the vehicle floor, the seat will not latch properly to the seat striker, allowing the seat to tip forward unexpectedly during braking.', u'Remedy': u"Honda will notify owners, and dealers will install a bracket to the second row outboard floor strikers, free of charge.  The recall began April 2, 2018.  Owners may contact American Honda Customer Support & Campaign Center at 1-888-234-2138.  Honda's number for this recall is S0G.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'ODYSSEY', u'Make': u'HONDA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1510894800000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.)'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V888000', u'Conequence': u'Corrosion of the wiring harness can cause increased electrical resistance, unexpectedly activating the vehicle stability assist (VSA) system, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:WIRING', u'Summary': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain model year 2017 Ridgeline AWD vehicles manufactured April 1, 2016, to August 11, 2016.  Water may enter the rear wiring harness through the connector located under the truck bed drain hole, possibly causing the connection terminals to corrode.', u'Remedy': u"Honda will notify owners, and dealers will inspect the rear wiring harness and related components, replacing them as necessary, free of charge.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138.  Honda's number for this recall is KD3.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'RIDGELINE', u'Make': u'HONDA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1481259600000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.)'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V053000', u'Conequence': u'A crack in the fuel pump feed port can allow pressurized fuel to leak out, increasing the risk of a fire.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:DELIVERY:FUEL PUMP', u'Summary': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2017-2019 Ridgeline trucks.  Exposure to acids, such as from car wash soaps, can result in the fuel pump feed port cracking.', u'Remedy': u'Honda will notify owners, and dealers will replace the fuel pump, if necessary, and install a fuel pump cover, free of charge.  The recall began March 14, 2019.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138.  The recall number for this recall is Q3V.', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'RIDGELINE', u'Make': u'HONDA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1548306000000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Honda (American Honda Motor Co.)'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V232000', u'Conequence': u'An air bag that does not inflate increases the risk of injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS:FRONTAL', u'Summary': u"Hyundai Motor Company (Hyundai) is recalling certain model year 2015-2016 Sonata vehicles manufactured May 29, 2014 to February 11, 2016, 2017 Elantra vehicles manufactured January 12, 2016 to February 22, 2016, and one 2016 Sonata Hybrid vehicle manufactured October 15, 2015.  In these vehicles, the driver's frontal air bag may be missing a chemical enhancer required for the second stage air bag deployment, resulting in the second stage not deploying in certain crashes.  The primary stage will deploy as intended.", u'Remedy': u"Hyundai will notify owners, and dealers will replace the driver's frontal air bag module, free of charge.  The recall began on May 5,2016. Owners may contact Hyundai customer service at 1-855-371-9460.  Hyundai's number for this recall is 144.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'ELANTRA', u'Make': u'HYUNDAI', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1461211200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Hyundai Motor America'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V956000', u'Conequence': u'In the event of a crash, an air bag that does not inflate fully increases the risk of injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS:FRONTAL:DRIVER SIDE INFLATOR MODULE', u'Summary': u"Hyundai Motor Company (Hyundai) is recalling certain model year 2017 Hyundai Elantra vehicles manufactured April 15, 2016, to September 13, 2016, and Sonata vehicles manufactured May 27, 2016 to September 16, 2016.  In these vehicles, the end seal for the driver's frontal air bag inflator may not have been properly installed, possibly resulting in reduced inflation of the frontal air bag in the event of a crash.", u'Remedy': u"Hyundai will notify owners, and dealers will replace the driver's frontal air bag module, free of charge.  The recall began February 13, 2017.  Owners may contact Hyundai customer service at 1-855-371-9460.  Hyundai's number for this recall is 156. ", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'ELANTRA', u'Make': u'HYUNDAI', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1483074000000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Hyundai Motor America'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V063000', u'Conequence': u'A loss of power brake assist can lengthen the distance needed to stop the vehicle, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:POWER ASSIST:HYDRAULIC', u'Summary': u'Hyundai Motor Company (Hyundai) is recalling certain 2017 Elantra vehicles. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V842000', u'Conequence': u'If the trailer brake lights stay illuminated while being used, other drivers may be confused, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:WIRING | TRAILER HITCHES', u'Summary': u'Hyundai Motor America (Hyundai) is recalling certain model year 2016-2017 Tucson vehicles manufactured May 19, 2015, to November 14, 2016, and 2017 Santa Fe vehicles manufactured November 28, 2015, to November 14, 2016. As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) number 108, " Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment."', u'Remedy': u"Hyundai will notify owners, and dealers will replace the affected accessory trailer hitch wiring harnesses, free of charge.  The recall is expected to begin January 13, 2017.  Owners may contact Hyundai customer service at 1-800-633-5151.  Hyundai's number for this recall is 153.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'TUCSON', u'Make': u'HYUNDAI', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1479704400000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Hyundai Motor America'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V244000', u'Conequence': u'If the passenger frontal air bag does not deploy as intended in the event of a crash, the passenger is at an increased risk of injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS: OCCUPANT CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM - OCS (FRONT PASSENGER)', u'Remedy': u'Nissan will notify their owners.  Chevrolet City Express owners will be notified by General Motors.  Dealers will reprogram the Air Bag Control Unit (ACU) and OCS Electronic Control Unit (ECU) in Altima, Maxima, Murano, Rogue, and Sentra vehicles, and replace the OCS ECU in LEAF, NV200, NV200 Taxi, Pathfinder, Infiniti Q50, JX35, and QX60 and Chevrolet City Express vehicles, free of charge.  Interim notices were sent to owners on May 31, 2016.  Owners will receive a second notice when remedy parts become available.  Owners may contact Nissan customer service at 1-800-867-7669, Infiniti customer service at 1-888-833-3216 or Chevrolet customer service at 1-800-222-1020. ', u'Summary': u'Nissan North America, Inc. (Nissan) is recalling certain model year 2016-2017 Nissan Maxima, 2013-2016 Nissan Altima, NV200, LEAF, Sentra, and Pathfinder, 2014-2016 Nissan NV200 Taxi, Infiniti QX60, QX60 Hybrid, and Q50 Hybrid, 2014-2017 Nissan Rogue and Infiniti Q50, 2015-2016 Nissan Murano, Murano Hybrid, and Chevrolet City Express, 2014-2015 Nissan Pathfinder Hybrid, and 2013 Infiniti JX35 vehicles.  In these vehicles, the front seat passenger Occupant Classification System (OCS) may incorrectly classify an adult passenger as a child or classify the seat as empty despite it being occupied.  As a result, the passenger frontal air bag may be turned off and not deploy in the event of a crash.', u'NHTSAActionNumber': u'EA15004', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'Q50', u'Make': u'INFINITI', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1461643200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Nissan North America, Inc.'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V476000', u'Conequence': u'An engine stall can increase the risk of a crash. ', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM: SOFTWARE | FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:DELIVERY:FUEL PUMP', u'Summary': u'Nissan North America, Inc. (Nissan) is recalling certain 2016-2018 Infiniti Q50 and 2017 Infiniti Q60 vehicles equipped with a 2.0L engine.  Incorrect Fuel Pump Control Module (FPCM) software may allow the fuel level in the main tank to be too low to supply fuel to the engine, causing the engine to stall while driving.', u'Remedy': u'Nissan will notify owners, and Infiniti dealers will reprogram the Fuel Pump Control Module (FPCM) with corrected software, free of charge.  The recall began August 29, 2017.  Owners may contact Infiniti customer service at 1-800-662-6200.', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'Q50', u'Make': u'INFINITI', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1501128000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Nissan North America, Inc.'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V571000', u'Conequence': u"In the event of a crash necessitating deployment of the driver's frontal air bag, the inflator may crack and release the gas needed to properly deploy the air bag, increasing the risk of injury. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V939000', u'Conequence': u'A passenger air bag that fails to deploy in the event of a crash can increase the risk of injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS:PASSENGER SIDE FRONTAL', u'Summary': u'Nissan North America, Inc. The affected vehicles have a passenger air bag inflator initiator that may fail to ignite during a crash, preventing the air bag from deploying.  As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) number 208, "Occupant Crash Protection."', u'Remedy': u'Nissan will notify owners, and dealers will replace the passenger air bag assembly, free of charge. (Nissan) is recalling certain 2017 Infiniti QX30 vehicles. The recall began on May 2, 2017. (Nissan) is recalling 2017-2018 Infiniti QX30 vehicles. The recall began March 26, 2018. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V601000', u'Conequence': u'A brake fluid leak on the circuit board may result in an electrical short, increasing the risk of a fire.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:ANTILOCK', u'Summary': u'Nissan North America, Inc. (Nissan) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Nissan Murano, 2016-2017 Nissan Maxima, 2017-2018 Nissan Pathfinder, and 2017 Infiniti QX60 vehicles.  The Anti-Lock Brake (ABS) actuator pumps may allow brake fluid to leak onto an internal circuit board.', u'Remedy': u'Nissan will notify owners, and dealers will inspect the serial number on the ABS actuator, replacing it as necessary, free of charge.  The recall began October 29, 2018.  Owners may contact Nissan customer service at 1-800-867-7669.  Note: When brake fluid has leaked onto the circuit board, the ABS warning lamp will remain illuminated for more than 10 seconds after engine start up.  If this occurs, owners are advised to park the vehicle outdoors away from other vehicles or structures and to not drive the vehicle.', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'QX60', u'Make': u'INFINITI', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1536292800000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Nissan North America, Inc.'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V807000', u'Conequence': u'A brake fluid leak on the circuit board may result in an electrical short, increasing the risk of a fire.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:ANTILOCK', u'Summary': u'Nissan North America, Inc. (Nissan) is recalling certain 2015-2018 Nissan Murano, 2016-2018 Nissan Maxima, and 2017-2019 Nissan Pathfinder and Infiniti QX60 vehicles.  These vehicles were previously recalled and unrepaired, or inspected and determined to not need a repair, under recall number 18V-601. In addition, this recall expands the previous population.  The Anti-lock Brake System (ABS) actuator pumps may allow brake fluid to leak onto an internal circuit board.', u'Remedy': u'Nissan will notify owners, and dealers will replace the ABS actuator, free of charge.  Owners will receive a second notice when remedy parts become available, currently expected to be during summer 2020.  Owners may contact Nissan customer service at 1-800-867-7669.  Note:  If the ABS warning light remains illuminated for more than 10 seconds after engine start up, owners are advised to park the vehicle outdoors away from other vehicles or structures and to not drive the vehicle. ', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'QX60', u'Make': u'INFINITI', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1573189200000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Nissan North America, Inc.'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V799000', u'Conequence': u"If the driver's knee air bag does not properly inflate, there is an increased risk of injury in the event of a crash.", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS:KNEE BOLSTER', u'Summary': u"Chrysler (FCA US LLC) is recalling certain model year 2017 Jeep Cherokee vehicles manufactured October 13, 2016, to October 17, 2016. The recall began November 9, 2016.  Owners may contact Chrysler customer service at 1-800-853-1403.  Chrysler's number for this recall is S84.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'CHEROKEE', u'Make': u'JEEP', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1478059200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Chrysler (FCA US LLC)'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V543000', u'Conequence': u'The missing tire and rim designation information may lead to an incorrect combination being installed on the vehicle, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT:OTHER:LABELS | WHEELS:RIM ', u'Summary': u'Chrysler (FCA US LLC) is recalling certain 2017-2018 Jeep Cherokee vehicles.  The tire and rim size information required to be on the Certification label was omitted during manufacturing, which may result in an incorrect tire and rim combination being installed on the vehicle.  As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) number 110, "Tire Selection and Rims."', u'Remedy': u"Chrysler will notify owners and will provide a corrected certification label, free of charge.  The recall began October 13, 2017.  Owners may contact Chrysler customer service at 1-800-853-1403.  Chrysler's number for this recall is T53.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'CHEROKEE', u'Make': u'JEEP', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1504152000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Chrysler (FCA US LLC)'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V332000', u'Conequence': u'If the vehicle maintains its speed or accelerates despite attempts to deactivate the cruise control, there would be an increased risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM: SOFTWARE | ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:WIRING | VEHICLE SPEED CONTROL:CRUISE CONTROL', u'Summary': u"Chrysler (FCA US LLC) is recalling certain 2014-2018 Dodge Journey, Charger and Durango, RAM 2500, 3500, 3500 Cab Chassis (more than 10,000lb), 4500 Cab Chassis and 5500 Cab Chassis, Jeep Cherokee and Grand Cherokee and Chrysler 300, 2014-2019 RAM 1500, 2015-2018 Dodge Challenger, 2015-2017 Chrysler 200, 2016-2018 RAM 3500 Cab Chassis (less than 10,000 lb), 2017-2018 Chrysler Pacifica and 2018 Jeep Wrangler vehicles.  These vehicles are being recalled to address a defect that could prevent the cruise control system from disengaging.  If, when using cruise control, there is a short circuit within the vehicle's wiring, the driver may not be able to shut off the cruise control either by depressing the brake pedal or manually turning the system off once it has been engaged, resulting in either the vehicle maintaining its current speed or possibly accelerating.  ", u'Remedy': u'Chrysler will notify owners, and dealers will inspect the software, and perform a software flash on the engine or powertrain control module, free of charge.  The recall began June 4, 2018.  Owners may contact Chrysler customer service at 1-800-853-1403.  Note: Owners are advised to stop using cruise control until the software update has been performed.  In the event that cruise control cannot be disengaged while driving, owners should firmly and steadily apply the brakes and shift the transmission to neutral, placing the vehicle in park once it has stopped.  ', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'CHEROKEE', u'Make': u'JEEP', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1526529600000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Chrysler (FCA US LLC)'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V190000', u'Conequence': u'Reduced braking performance can lengthen the distance needed to stop the vehicle, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:POWER ASSIST:VACUUM:HOSES, LINES/PIPING, AND FITTINGS', u'Summary': u'Kia Motors America (Kia) is recalling certain 2017 Cadenza vehicles.  The brake vacuum hose on the affected vehicles may kink, reducing braking performance.', u'Remedy': u"Kia will notify owners, and dealers will inspect the brake vacuum hose, replacing it as necessary, free charge.  The recall began on April 17, 2017.  Owners may contact Kia customer service at 1-800-333-4542.  Kia's number for this recall is SC146.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'CADENZA', u'Make': u'KIA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1489636800000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Kia Motors America'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V257000', u'Conequence': u'An electrical short can increase the risk of a fire.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'HYBRID PROPULSION SYSTEM', u'Summary': u'Kia Motors America (Kia) is recalling certain 2017 Kia Niro vehicles.  The Hydraulic Clutch Actuator (HCA) inner oil seal may leak, allowing oil to accumulate in the cap area, possibly resulting in an electrical short.', u'Remedy': u"Kia will notify owners, and dealers will inspect the HCA caps for leaked oil and replace the HCA assembly if needed, or replace the HCA cap with additional sealant.  These repairs will be performed free of charge.  The recall is expected to begin June 15, 2018.  Owners may contact Kia customer service at 1-800-333-4542.  Kia's number for this recall is SC163.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'NIRO', u'Make': u'KIA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1524196800000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Kia Motors America'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V666000', u'Conequence': u'The increased electrical resistance can overheat the rear seat which is above the PRA, increasing the risk of a fire.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'HYBRID PROPULSION SYSTEM', u'Summary': u'Kia Motors America (Kia) is recalling certain 2017-2018 Kia Niro hybrid electric vehicles.  The Main Relay within the Power Relay Assembly (PRA) may have inadequate connections between its contacts, causing increased electrical resistance. ', u'Remedy': u"Kia will notify owners, and dealers will inspect the Power Relay Assembly (PRA) for damage.  If no damage is found, the main relay will be replaced.  If damage is found, the PRA will be replaced.  These repairs will be performed free of charge.  The recall began November 23, 2018.  Owners may contact Kia customer service at 1-800-333-4542.  Kia's number for this recall is SC168.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'NIRO', u'Make': u'KIA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1537848000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Kia Motors America'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V161000', u'Conequence': u'If the VPD activates while the vehicle is being operated in Electric Vehicle (EV) mode, there may be a loss of power, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'HYBRID PROPULSION SYSTEM', u'Summary': u'Kia Motors America (Kia) is recalling certain 2017-2018 Kia Optima hybrid vehicles.  These vehicles are equipped with a Voltage Protection Device (VPD), designed to protect the high voltage battery module, that may activate inadvertently. ', u'Remedy': u"Kia will notify owners, and dealers will remove the VPD switch and install two newly designed Battery Management Systems (BMS) that contain Overvoltage Protection Devices (OPDs), free of charge.  The recall is expected to begin May 2018.  Owners may contact Kia customer service at 1-800-333-4542.  Kia's number for this recall is SC162.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'OPTIMA', u'Make': u'KIA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1520485200000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Kia Motors America'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V907000', u'Conequence': u'A fuel leak in the presence of an ignition source can increase the risk of a fire.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ENGINE | FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:DELIVERY:HOSES, LINES/PIPING, AND FITTINGS', u'Remedy': u"Kia has notified owners, and dealers will inspect and replace the fuel pipe, as necessary, free of charge.  The recall began January 17, 2019.  Owners may contact Kia customer service at 1-800-333-4542.  Kia's number for this recall is SC172.", u'Summary': u'Kia Motors America (Kia) is recalling certain 2011-2017 Optima, 2012-2017 Sorento and 2011-2018 Sportage vehicles that previously received an engine replacement under recall number 17V-224, warranty, or the Knock Sensor Detection System (KSDS) Product Improvement Campaign.  The high pressure fuel pipe that connects to the fuel pump outlet may have been damaged, misaligned or improperly torqued during the engine replacement procedure, possibly causing a fuel leak.', u'NHTSAActionNumber': u'DP18003 | DP18003', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'OPTIMA', u'Make': u'KIA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1545195600000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Kia Motors America'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V338000', u'Conequence': u'If the door closes on an occupant, there is an increased risk of an injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM: SOFTWARE | STRUCTURE:BODY:DOOR ', u'Summary': u'Kia Motors America (Kia) is recalling certain 2015-2018 Kia Sedona vehicles equipped with a power sliding door (PSD).  The PSD may not auto-reverse when its closing is obstructed.', u'Remedy': u"Kia will notify owners, and dealers will reprogram the PSD module software, free of charge.  The recall began on June 18, 2018.  Owners may contact Kia customer service at 1-800-333-4542.  Kia's number for this recall is SC164.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'SEDONA', u'Make': u'KIA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1527048000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Kia Motors America'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V109000', u'Conequence': u'If a child is in a child seat in the front seat, a broken ODS wiring harness will not prevent the front passenger air bag from deploying in the event of a crash, increasing the risk of injury to the child.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:WIRING', u'Summary': u'Kia Motors America (Kia) is recalling certain 2015-2018 Sedona vehicles equipped with manually-adjusted front passenger seats. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V862000', u'Conequence': u'If the trailer brake lights stay illuminated while being used, other drivers may be confused, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM | TRAILER HITCHES', u'Summary': u'Kia Motors America (Kia) is recalling certain model year 2016-2017 Sorento vehicles manufactured October 27, 2014, to August 25, 2016, and 2017 Sportage vehicles manufactured December 10, 2015, to August 26, 2016.  The affected vehicles are equipped with an accessory trailer hitch wiring harness that, due to a malfunction of the tow hitch module, may result in the trailer brake lights being constantly illuminated.  As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) number 108, " Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment."', u'Remedy': u"Kia will notify owners, and dealers will replace the trailer tow hitch harness, free of charge.  The recall began January 18, 2017.  Owners may contact Kia customer service at 1-800-333-4542. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V337000', u'Conequence': u'If the engine were to shut off, it can cause loss of power brake assistance.  An engine stall would cause a loss of drive power.  Both scenarios can increase the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM: SOFTWARE | FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE', u'Summary': u'Jaguar Land Rover North America, LLC (Land Rover) is recalling certain 2017 Land Rover Range Rover, Range Rover Sport, and Discovery vehicles.  The fuel gauge on these vehicles may indicate that the fuel level is low and illuminate the warning lamp, when the fuel tank actually has more fuel.  The engine management software may also cut off the engine when the vehicle has traveled approximately 17 more miles.', u'Remedy': u"Land Rover will notify owners, and dealers will install a software update to correct the fuel level reading, free of charge.  The recall began on June 22, 2018.  Owners may Land Rover customer service at 1-800-637-6837.  Land Rover's number for this recall is N206.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'DISCOVERY', u'Make': u'LAND ROVER', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1527048000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Jaguar Land Rover North America, LLC'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V731000', u'Conequence': u'Reduced turn signal visibility to other drivers and pedestrians can increase the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EXTERIOR LIGHTING:HEADLIGHTS', u'Summary': u'Ford Motor Company (Ford) is recalling certain model year 2017 Lincoln Continental vehicles manufactured June 14, 2016, to September 23, 2016 and equipped with high intensity discharge (HID) headlights. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V263000', u'Conequence': u"In the event of a crash, if the occupant's knee contacts the rigid structure, there may be an increased risk of injury. ", u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'STRUCTURE', u'Summary': u'Lotus Cars USA, Inc. (Lotus) is recalling certain 2017-2018 Evora vehicles.  The toe board in the passenger footwell lacks stiffness, allowing the knee of an unbelted occupant to contact the rigid structure of the vehicle, in the event of a crash.  As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) number 208, "Occupant Crash Protection." ', u'Remedy': u"Lotus will notify owners, and dealers will replace the toe board with a new design to provide the appropriate stiffness, free of charge. The recall began May 27, 2019. Owners may contact Lotus customer service at 1-800-245-6887. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V744000', u'Conequence': u'Contact with the muffler may damage the trailer wiring harness, potentially resulting in the trailer lighting being inoperative, thereby increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:WIRING | TRAILER HITCHES', u'Summary': u'Mazda North American Operations (Mazda) is recalling certain 2017 CX-5 vehicles equipped with an accessory trailer hitch wiring harness. Mazda's number for this recall is 1617K.", u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'CX-5', u'Make': u'MAZDA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1511240400000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Mazda North American Operations'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V272000', u'Conequence': u'Reduced visibility while driving can increase the risk of crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'VISIBILITY:WINDSHIELD WIPER/WASHER', u'Summary': u"Mazda North American Operations (Mazda) is recalling certain 2016-2018 Mazda3 vehicles. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V753000', u'Conequence': u'A vehicle continuously driven with the turn signal flashing may result in confusion to other drivers, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EXTERIOR LIGHTING:TURN SIGNAL', u'Summary': u'Mazda North American Operations (Mazda) is recalling certain model year 2017 Mazda6 vehicles manufactured August 12, 2016, to September 28, 2016 and equipped with optional accessory fog lights. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V553000', u'Conequence': u'If a side curtain air bag does not inflate as intended in the event of a crash, there is an increased risk of injury to the front seat occupants.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.\r\n', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS:SIDE/WINDOW', u'Summary': u'BMW of North America, LLC (BMW) is recalling certain model year 2016-2017 MINI Clubman vehicles manufactured August 19, 2015, through July 14, 2016. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V675000', u'Conequence': u"Without the horizontal adjustment locking clip being secured, the headlight can be adjusted to either reduce the driver's visibility or blind oncoming vehicles. ', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM: SOFTWARE | FORWARD COLLISION AVOIDANCE: PEDESTRIAN AUTOMATIC EMERGENCY BRAKING', u'Summary': u'Mitsubishi Motors North America (MMNA) is recalling certain 2018 Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV, Outlander Sport, 2018-2019 Eclipse Cross, and 2017-2018 Outlander vehicles equipped with a Forward Collision Mitigation (FCM) system that detects pedestrians.   Due to incorrect software, the FCM-ECU (Electronic Control Unit) may apply braking for longer than needed, even after a pedestrian is no longer detected.  ', u'Remedy': u"MMNA will notify owners, and dealers will reprogram the FCM-ECU software with updated software, free of charge.  The recall is began October 16, 2018. The software for the Hydraulic Unit Electronic Control Unit (ECU) may be incorrect, possibly preventing the intervention of a safety system such as automatic emergency braking, Anti-lock Braking (ABS), Electronic Stability Control (ESC), or the Brake Auto Hold (BAH) function when any of these systems are in use.', u'Remedy': u"MMNA will notify owners, and dealers will update the Hydraulic Unit-ECU software, free of charge. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V040000', u'Conequence': u'If the rear passenger doors inadvertently open while the vehicle is in motion, it may increase the risk of injury to the rear passengers.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'LATCHES/LOCKS/LINKAGES:DOORS:LATCH', u'Summary': u'Nissan North America, Inc. (Nissan) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Altima vehicles. The rear door latch/lock cable on the vehicles may have been improperly routed.  As a result, lowering a rear window may inadvertently cause that door to unlatch and open.', u'Remedy': u'Nissan will notify owners, and dealers will correct the rear door latch/lock cable routing, free of charge.  The recall began on February 16, 2017.  Owners may contact Nissan customer service at 1-800-647-7261.', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'ALTIMA', u'Make': u'NISSAN', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1484715600000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Nissan North America, Inc.'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V915000', u'Conequence': u'If the rear passenger door opens while the vehicle is moving, the rear passengers have an increased risk of injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'LATCHES/LOCKS/LINKAGES:DOORS:LATCH | STRUCTURE:BODY:DOOR/WINDOW:EMERGENCY EXIT', u'Summary': u'Nissan North America, Inc. (Nissan) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Altima vehicles, previously remedied under recall number 17V-040.  The door latch-lock cable may not have been routed properly in the rear door when the remedy was applied.  As a result, the cable may interfere with the window regulator causing the rear passenger door to unlatch and inadvertently open without warning when the window is lowered. ', u'Remedy': u'Nissan will notify owners, and dealers will secure the latch-lock cables in the correct position using the new remedy procedure, free of charge.  The recall began February 5, 2019.  Owners may contact Nissan customer service at 1-800-647-7669. ', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'ALTIMA', u'Make': u'NISSAN', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1545195600000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Nissan North America, Inc.'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V551000', u'Conequence': u'If the vehicle stalls, it can increase the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:IGNITION', u'Summary': u'Nissan North America, Inc. (Nissan) is recalling certain 2017 Nissan NV200, Sentra, NV3500 Van, NV3500 Bus, NV200 Taxi, NV1500, NV2500 Van, Chevrolet City Express, 2017-2018 Frontier, Versa Note, and Versa Sedan vehicles that have a mechanical (physical) key ignition system.  In these models, over time, the weight on the key ring and road conditions or some other jarring event may cause the ignition switch to move out of the run position to the accessory position, turning off the engine.', u'Remedy': u'Nissan will notify owners, and dealers will inspect the production information on the ignition switch, and replace it as necessary, free of charge.  The recall began October 1, 2018.  Owners may contact Nissan customer service at 1-800-867-7669.', u'ModelYear': u'2017', u'Model': u'FRONTIER', u'Make': u'NISSAN', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1534824000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Nissan North America, Inc.'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V086000', u'Conequence': u'If brake fluid leaks into the brake booster it can lengthen the distance needed to stop the vehicle, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:FOUNDATION COMPONENTS:MASTER CYLINDER', u'Summary': u'Nissan North America, Inc. (Nissan) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Nissan Juke Nismo RS vehicles.
